data.text:
Weather overview

In the quaint town of Cambria, located on the beautiful coast of the United States of America, the weather is typically warm with a range of climate conditions through the year. Daytime temperatures can vary, averaging 17Â Â°CÂ (63Â Â°F) in the cooler month of January and reaching highs of around 24Â Â°CÂ (74Â Â°F) by September. Precipitation patterns vary such that July is the driest month with only 0Â days of rainfall, while February is known for being the wettest, with rain falling on an average of 9Â days. Regarding marine conditions, the sea temperatures exhibit a mild gradient from a low of 12Â Â°CÂ (54Â Â°F) in April to a pleasant 16Â Â°CÂ (60Â Â°F) come September. When it comes to nocturnal temperatures, the warmest nights typically occur in August with an average temperature of 11Â Â°CÂ (52Â Â°F), whereas December nights are the chilliest, dipping to 5Â Â°CÂ (40Â Â°F).

January weather

The peak rainfall amount, amounting to 120Â mmÂ (4.74Â in), is recorded in Cambria. The day temperature starts at its lowest for the year, averaging 17Â Â°CÂ (63Â Â°F), and we begin to see an increase in sun hours, totaling 6Â hours. A gentle breeze prevails, with the wind at its calmest, blowing at a mere 3.

February weather

Cambria sees the highest number of rainy days this month, with 9Â days. There's a noticeable decrease in rainfall volume, which is 109Â mmÂ (4.28Â in). Overnight temperatures start to warm up, standing at 6Â Â°CÂ (42Â Â°F), and the amount of sunshine continues to increase, now at 7Â hours.

March weather

The trend of decreasing rainy days is apparent with adaunting 8Â days in Cambria, while rainfall continues its descent to 92Â mmÂ (3.63Â in). The increase in day temperature is also beginning to be noted. More sunny hours grace the town, now at 9Â hours.

April weather

Cambria's sea temperature hits its minimum for the year at 12Â Â°CÂ (54Â Â°F), while land temperatures continue their ascent by averaging 19Â Â°CÂ (67Â Â°F). Rainfall and rainy days decrease further to 36Â mmÂ (1.43Â in) and 5Â days, respectively. The trend of warming night temperatures is also beginning, with an average of 7Â Â°CÂ (44Â Â°F), and the number of sunlit hours reaches 10Â hours.

May weather

Day temperatures in May steadily climb, reaching 20Â Â°CÂ (68Â Â°F) in Cambria, and the nocturnal temperatures also rise, averaging 8Â Â°CÂ (47Â Â°F). The rainy season begins to recede with only 2Â days, and the rainfall amount keeps reducing, standing at 12Â mmÂ (0.46Â in). The start of the dry season is heralded. The number of cloud-free sun hours continues to escalate, now hitting 11Â hours.

June weather

As June unfolds, Cambria experiences a climb in sea temperatures, now at 13Â Â°CÂ (56Â Â°F). The warmth of the sunny days is more intense, reaching 22Â Â°CÂ (71Â Â°F). Rain becomes a rare event with just 1Â day, and the rainfall amount decreases substantially to a mere 2Â mmÂ (0.08Â in). Maximum sun hours are now the norm. The lowest levels of humidity for the year can also be discerned.

July weather

The buoyant tourist season gently commences in July, with a noticeable increase in sea temperature to 14Â Â°CÂ (58Â Â°F). Daytime peaks at a comfortable 22Â Â°CÂ (72Â Â°F). The fewest number of rainy days is recorded along with a scant rainfall volume of 1Â mmÂ (0.03Â in). Nighttime warmth is on the rise, hitting an average of 11Â Â°CÂ (51Â Â°F).

August weather

During the peak of the tourist season in August, and throughout the dry spell, Cambria sees daytime temperatures average a delightful 23Â Â°CÂ (74Â Â°F). Sea temperatures also peak, warming to an average of 15Â Â°CÂ (59Â Â°F). The utmost in nighttime warmth is observed at an average of 11Â Â°CÂ (52Â Â°F). Although sun hours remain high, a subtle decrease starts to manifest.

September weather

The concluding moments of the tourist season in September bring maximum day and sea temperatures, 24Â Â°CÂ (74Â Â°F) and 16Â Â°CÂ (60Â Â°F), respectively. The commencement of cooler nights is sensed with an average of 11Â Â°CÂ (51Â Â°F). The sunny hours also begin to decrease, with 9Â hours recorded. Rainy days are once more on the uptick.

October weather

As the tourist season reaches its zenith in October, so does the dry spell in Cambria. A slight decline in day temperatures is noted, averaging 23Â Â°CÂ (73Â Â°F), while nighttime temperatures also take a dip to 9Â Â°CÂ (49Â Â°F). A gentle increase in rainy days is seen with 3Â days, and a gradual rise in rainfall volume kicks off, measuring 25Â mmÂ (1.00Â in).

November weather

With day temperatures drawing back slightly to a moderate 20Â Â°CÂ (68Â Â°F) in Cambria, and sea temperatures beginning their descent at 14Â Â°CÂ (58Â Â°F), November sees an increase in rainy days to 6Â days and a notable surge in the volume of rainfall, up to 56Â mmÂ (2.20Â in). Nighttime temperatures also drop, averaging 7Â Â°CÂ (45Â Â°F), and the amount of sunshine diminishes to 6Â hours.

December weather

December's daytime temperatures match the annual low in Cambria, plateauing at 17Â Â°CÂ (63Â Â°F), likewise echoed by the sea temperatures which continue to slide down to 14Â Â°CÂ (56Â Â°F). The rainy days pile up, registering 7Â days, as well as the rainfall volume, showing 95Â mmÂ (3.74Â in). The coldest nights of the year herald their arrival, and sunshine becomes all the more precious, with the shortest sunlit hours at 5Â hours.
